name: Shoka
description:
*After years of procrastination, I finally sat down for a month and turned a 2nd person game I played with some friends into a 3rd person JRPG playable by everyone*

The most grueling and unfair Isekai turn based RPG made with a budget of literally $0 (got RPG Maker VXA from a steam key giveaway), most will fail over and over and over until they eventually gives up and quit.  Will you accept the challenge or chicken out? The choice is yours to be made. I pride myself on my ability to create a game with consistent power scaling and no plot holes.

This game is also packed with plenty of references to other games,anime, meme culture etcetera to the point where it's only 50% original content. There's also a few lot of hidden content so be sure to interact with everything, every square might prove to be useful.

The actual final boss is pretty much unbeatable so if someone do manage to beat them without stat manipulation and 100% the game, I commend you heavily,  you're probably the best turn based RPG player alive and deserve something special! To put it in perspective, I saw the game over screen 3 times when debugging the final boss, and that's with all the broken items and stat manipulations in the world.

The game up until the final battle is actually pretty short, around a few hours of gameplay if you managed to grind efficiently and beat everything first try, but if you can actually do that, I fucked up, hard.

There will be minimal images posted on this page to reduce spoilers as games are best played blind, the blinder the better so I'll just write a list of features that this game contains. If you do not care about spoilers, then feel free to watch the trailer and read the full analysis in the comments.

"Features"

- Fast Pace & Unfair Battles

- Limited Saving Opportunities

- Greedy Shopkeepers

- Combo System

- Die over and over and over!

"People Who Helped This Game Directly"
- Asgarolt(Artist)

- TaoOat(RPG Maker VX Ace Steam Key Giver)

Note: Alternate reality combatants' power levels may not be accurate to their canon.
